dmca.title: Notice ID: 20-9349 Copyright Takedown Notification
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: marvel-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
[mailto:marvel-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, July 26, 2005 7:21 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Notice ID: 20-9349 Copyright Takedown Notification

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

27 Jul 2005 00:11:21 GMT
Notice ID: 20-9349 

Re: Unauthorized Use of "Marvel" Property

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

Dear Sir or Madam:

I certify under penalty of perjury that I am an agent authorized to act on
behalf of Marvel Characters, Inc. and Marvel Enterprises, Inc. (collectively
"Marvel"), the owner of certain valuable intellectual property rights.
Marvel is the owner of all trademark, copyright and other intellectual
property rights in and to the comic books published under the Marvel
imprints, including, but not limited to, SPIDER-MAN, X-MEN, DAREDEVIL,
CAPTAIN AMERICA, THE FANTASTIC FOUR, THE PUNISHER, THE HULK, and many others
(the "Marvel Properties").  Because of these rights, no one is authorized to
manufacture, distribute, copy, sell and/or offer for sale products/services
utilizing the Marvel Properties without the express written permission of
Marvel.
"Marvel", Inc. and its affiliated companies (collectively, "Marvel") are the
exclusive owners of copyrights in (description of property), including the
(property) listed below.

It has come to our attention that ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. is
the service provider for the IP address listed below, from which
unauthorized copying and distribution (downloading, uploading, file serving,
file "swapping" or other similar activities) of "Marvel"'s (property)(s)
listed below is taking place. We believe that the Internet access of the
user engaging in this infringement is provided by organization or a
downstream service provider who purchases this connectivity from
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc..

This unauthorized copying and distribution constitutes copyright
infringement under Section 106 of the U.S. Copyright Act . Depending upon
the type of service ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. is providing to
this IP address, it may have legal and/or equitable liability if it does not
expeditiously remove or disable access to the (property)(s) listed below, or
if it fails to implement a policy that provides for termination of
subscribers who are repeat infringers (see, 17 U.S.C.
